ygData.subject: Re: exp gain
ygData.msgSnippet: Honestly, I don t remember for certain :P  More than likely, off a sight of someone who gets some weird kick from number-crunching EQ more than playing it :)
ygData.messageBody:
Honestly, I don't remember for certain :P More than likely, off a sight of
someone who gets some weird kick from number-crunching EQ more than playing
it :)



>From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <slide@...>
>Reply-To: EverQuest@onelist.com
>To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] exp gain
>Date: Wed, 15 Sep 1999 01:43:21 -0500
>
>From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <slide@...>
>
>Not that I'm implying you're wrong (personally I have no clue) but I'm
>curious what your source is for these figures...
>
>Thanks
>
>Slyde of Xegony
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Jannus Malus <jannus_@...>
>To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
>Sent: Tuesday, September 14, 1999 11:35 PM
>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] exp gain
>
>
> > From: "Jannus Malus" <jannus_@...>
> >
> > The XP Penalties/bonuses break down as follow:
> >
> > Human gets a 20% XP bonus over other races - all other races (Warrior
>class
> > to avoid class penalty) gain xp at the same rate (unless one of the
> > following applies)
> >
> > Hybrids take a 20% xp penalty
> >
> > XP giving kills in a "dungeon" zone give a 25% xp bonus
> >
> > So a human pali would level at the exact same rate as a Dwarvish
>warrior.
> >
>
>
>
